div.p: INFLUENCETYPE is an optional attribute found in WRITING PRODUCTION PINFLUENCESHER . It is used to indicate how someone or something influenced a woman writer. It has three values: literary, intellectual and familial. If a text or person influenced a woman writer's literary style of techniques, use literary; if it influenced her ideas or opinions, use intellectual; if she took inspiration or advice from literary practices or ideas of a parent or other relation, use familial.

div.codeblock: <PINFLUENCESHER INFLUENCETYPE="literary">Angela Carter's neo-Gothic magic realism is indebted to Isak Dineson, Djuna Barnes, and Jane Bowles.</PINFLUENCESHER>
<PINFLUENCESHER INFLUENCETYPE="literary">Carolina Nairne's writing was heavily influenced by Robert Burns.</PINFLUENCESHER>

<PINFLUENCESHER INFLUENCETYPE="familial">At the urging of her sister the prioress, WMCN wrote out her story of rescuing her husband . . . . She told her sister that "noe body but your selfe could have obtain'd [this] from me."</PINFLUENCESHER>

div.p: Sometimes it’s a judgement call whether to put some information in FAMILY, MEMBER, or in PINFLUENCESHER=familial. Sometimes it’s worth using both tag contexts (in BIOGRAPHY and WRITING) without repeating words.
